name: ValueSetR5AssertResponseCodeTypesForR4
title: Cross-version ValueSet R5.AssertionResponseTypes for use in FHIR R4
description: This cross-version ValueSet represents content from http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/assert-response-code-types|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4 that is appropriate for use but unavailable in `http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/assert-response-code-types|4.0.1`.
purpose:
This value set is part of the cross-version definitions generated to enable use of the
value set `http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/assert-response-code-types|5.0.0` as defined in FHIR R5
in FHIR R4.

The source value set is bound to the following FHIR R5 elements:
* `TestScript.setup.action.assert.response` as Required

Across FHIR versions, the value set has been mapped as:
* `http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/assert-response-code-types|5.0.0`
* `http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/assert-response-code-types|4.3.0`
* `http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/assert-response-code-types|4.0.1`

The following concepts are not included in this cross-version definition because they have valid representations
* `http://hl7.org/fhir/assert-response-code-types#badGateway`
* `http://hl7.org/fhir/assert-response-code-types#badRequest`
* `http://hl7.org/fhir/assert-response-code-types#conflict`
* `http://hl7.org/fhir/assert-response-code-types#contentTooLarge`
* `http://hl7.org/fhir/assert-response-code-types#created`
* `http://hl7.org/fhir/assert-response-code-types#expectationFailed`
* `http://hl7.org/fhir/assert-response-code-types#forbidden`
* `http://hl7.org/fhir/assert-response-code-types#gatewayTimeout`
* `http://hl7.org/fhir/assert-response-code-types#gone`
* `http://hl7.org/fhir/assert-response-code-types#httpVersionNotSupported`
* `http://hl7.org/fhir/assert-response-code-types#internalServerError`
* `http://hl7.org/fhir/assert-response-code-types#lengthRequired`
* `http://hl7.org/fhir/assert-response-code-types#methodNotAllowed`
* `http://hl7.org/fhir/assert-response-code-types#misdirectedRequest`
* `http://hl7.org/fhir/assert-response-code-types#movedPermanently`
* `http://hl7.org/fhir/assert-response-code-types#noContent`
* `http://hl7.org/fhir/assert-response-code-types#notAcceptable`
* `http://hl7.org/fhir/assert-response-code-types#notFound`
* `http://hl7.org/fhir/assert-response-code-types#notImplemented`
* `http://hl7.org/fhir/assert-response-code-types#notModified`
* `http://hl7.org/fhir/assert-response-code-types#paymentRequired`

* `http://hl7.org/fhir/assert-response-code-types#preconditionFailed`
* `http://hl7.org/fhir/assert-response-code-types#proxyAuthenticationRequired`
* `http://hl7.org/fhir/assert-response-code-types#rangeNotSatisfiable`
* `http://hl7.org/fhir/assert-response-code-types#requestTimeout`

* `http://hl7.org/fhir/assert-response-code-types#uriTooLong`

Following are the generation technical comments:
One or more source concepts are either not mapped or broader than their targets, so the value set relationship is broadened.
One or more source concepts are narrower than their targets, so the value set relationship is narrowed.
The source value set has more active concepts (44) than the target (12), so the source is broader than the target.
All concepts in the comparison are listed as identical.
The source and target value sets have the same number of active concepts (12).
Using explicit mapping from `http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/assert-response-code-types|5.0.0` to `http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/assert-response-code-types|4.0.1` in `http://hl7.org/fhir/uv/xver/5.0/ConceptMap/R5-AssertResponseCodeTypes-R4-AssertResponseCodeTypes` (`ConceptMap-R5-AssertResponseCodeTypes-R4-AssertResponseCodeTypes.json`)
